brief.brief: The Lock command panel requests exclusive or shared use of a system resource or checks to see if a system resource already has a lock on it.

detail.detail: Resource Name: (character) Specify the Service Manager resource.
Exclusive Request: (Boolean) Specify whether you are making a request for exclusive use of this resource.
Conditional Request: (Boolean) Specify whether you want to wait for use of this resource.
Exit if Lock Denied: (label) Specify the exit to take if the resource is in use and you do not want to wait.
When more than one program modifies the same resource, you may want to prevent simultaneous use of the resource.
Service Manager automatically controls all resource sharing in its built-in functions.

However, if you want to increase this control (such as by locking an entire table or list of records for an update application), use the lock panel to keep others from using a resource while you are modifying it.
You cannot use the lock panel to prevent simultaneous use of a system resource.
You can only use it to test for simultaneous use of a system resource.
The lock panel asks Service Manager to assign control of a system resource to the active task.

Service Manager determines the status of the resource, and either grants the request by returning control to the active task or delays assignment of control by placing the active task in the wait condition.
You can request exclusive of shared control of the resources for a task by using the different options available on the lock panel.
If you plan to modify a resource, you must request exclusive control of it.
